svt_axi_fifo_mem Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_axi_fifo_mem:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is used to model a single FIFO.

An instance of this class represents a FIFO in a single address location.

Internally, the memory is modeled with a queue of elements.

  function void
 svt_axi_fifo_mem::new
 (  string name = "svt_transaction_inst", string suite_name = "", int data_width = 32, int addr = 0  ) 

CONSTRUCTOR: Create a new instance of this class.

When this object is created, the FIFO is assigned an instance name, data width, and an address.

name - Intance name for this memory object

suite_name - Name of the suite in which the memory is used.

data_width - The data width of this memory.

addr - The address of this FIFO.

  function bit
 svt_axi_fifo_mem::read
 (  int index = -1, output logic [SVT_AXI_MAX_DATA_WIDTH-1:0] data  ) 

Returns the value of the data word stored by this object.

index - The index within the FIFO to be read. If -1 is provided, the element in front of queue is read and popped out of the queue. If index is not -1, the element at the given index is read, but is not popped out of the queue

data - The data stored at the given index. If the index does not exist or if the queue is empty, the data is not valid.

Return values - Returns 1 if the element at given index exists. If the index does not exist or if the queue is empty, returns 0.

  function bit
 svt_axi_fifo_mem::write
 (  bit [SVT_AXI_MAX_DATA_WIDTH-1:0] data = 0  ) 

Stores a data word as the last element of the queue.

data - The data word to be stored.

Return values - Returns 1 if the write was successful, or 0 if it was not successful.

 svt_axi_fifo_mem::addr = 0

 int  attribute
 svt_axi_fifo_mem::data_width = 0

Stores the effective data width, as defined by the configuration.
